Comment: Because of the spill-over that is why. To assume that this situation is isolated between Russia and Ukraine is beyond short-sighted.  [New alliances in a divided region: Confronting the Kremlin’s aggression and the Balkans’ old ghosts – The Ballkan Forum](https://thebalkanforum.org/2025/04/17/new-alliances-in-a-divided-region-confronting-the-kremlins-aggression-and-the-balkans-old-ghosts/)  As to the war piece:  * **First Balkan War (1912–1913)**    * Balkan League (Serbia, Montenegro, Greece, and Bulgaria) vs. Ottoman Empire.    * Goal: Push the Ottomans out of Europe. * **Second Balkan War (1913)**    * Bulgaria vs. its former allies (Serbia, Greece, Montenegro) and later Romania and the Ottoman Empire.    * Cause: Disputes over the division of territory won in the First Balkan War. * **World War I (1914–1918)**    * Triggered directly by the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria-Hungary **in Sarajevo (Bosnia)** by a Bosnian Serb nationalist.    * While WWI became a global conflict, its spark came from deep-rooted Balkan tensions. * **World War II (1939–1945)** — Balkan Campaigns    * Although WWII didn't *start* in the Balkans, the region saw major fighting, especially with the Axis invasion of Yugoslavia and Greece in 1941.    * Yugoslavia and Greece became key battlegrounds in early WWII. * **Yugoslav Wars (1991–2001)**    * A series of conflicts following the breakup of Yugoslavia:       * Ten-Day War (Slovenia, 1991)       * Croatian War of Independence (1991–1995)       * Bosnian War (1992–1995)       * Kosovo War (1998–1999)
